intro: Lechea villosa var. schaffneri, commonly known as the Schaffner's hairy lechea, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related genera. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
